title: Proverbs Chapter 21 Quiz - Multi-Level
description: An enhanced quiz on Proverbs chapter 21 with Easy, Medium, Hard, and Theological levels. Each level has 15 carefully crafted questions. Choose your difficulty and dive in!

easy.title: Proverbs Chapter 21 Quiz - Easy Level
easy.description: Perfect for beginners! Test your basic knowledge of Proverbs Chapter 21.

questions.question: According to Proverbs 21:1, whose heart is in the hand of the LORD?
questions.correctAnswer: The king's heart
questions.explanation: Proverbs 21:1 states that the king's heart is in the hand of the LORD, showing God's control over rulers.

questions.question: What does Proverbs 21:3 say is more acceptable to the LORD than sacrifice?
questions.correctAnswer: To do justice and judgment
questions.explanation: Proverbs 21:3 emphasizes that acting justly and judging rightly please the LORD more than sacrifices.

questions.question: According to Proverbs 21:5, the thoughts of the diligent tend to what?
questions.correctAnswer: Plenteousness
questions.explanation: Proverbs 21:5 contrasts the diligent, whose thoughts lead to abundance, with the hasty who only come to want.

questions.question: True or False: Proverbs 21:9 says it is better to live with a brawling woman in a wide house than alone on a housetop corner.
questions.correctAnswer: False
questions.explanation: Proverbs 21:9 states it is better to dwell in a corner of the housetop than with a brawling woman in a wide house.

questions.question: Who does Proverbs 21:11 say gains wisdom when the scorner is punished?
questions.correctAnswer: The simple
questions.explanation: Proverbs 21:11 teaches that when the scorner is punished, the simple become wise.

questions.question: What does Proverbs 21:13 warn will happen to one who stops his ears at the cry of the poor?
options: He shall cry himself, but not be heard
He shall be honored by the LORD
questions.correctAnswer: He shall cry himself, but not be heard
questions.explanation: Proverbs 21:13 warns that ignoring the poor's cry results in one not receiving help when in need.

questions.question: Complete the verse from Proverbs 21:20: 'There is treasure to be desired and oil in the dwelling of the ______;'
questions.correctAnswer: wise
questions.explanation: Proverbs 21:20 highlights the wise person’s home as having desirable treasure and oil, indicating prosperity.

questions.question: According to Proverbs 21:21, what does he that followeth after righteousness and mercy find?
questions.correctAnswer: Life, righteousness, and honour
questions.explanation: Proverbs 21:21 says pursuing righteousness and mercy results in life, righteousness, and honor.

questions.question: True or False: Proverbs 21:23 states that keeping one's mouth and tongue helps keep one's soul from troubles.
questions.correctAnswer: True
questions.explanation: Proverbs 21:23 affirms that controlling speech protects the soul from troubles.

questions.question: What does Proverbs 21:25 say kills the slothful man?
questions.correctAnswer: Desire
questions.explanation: Proverbs 21:25 explains that the desire of the slothful kills him because he refuses to work.

questions.question: According to Proverbs 21:30, what is there no wisdom, understanding, or counsel against?
questions.correctAnswer: The LORD
questions.explanation: Proverbs 21:30 declares that no wisdom, understanding, or counsel can stand against the LORD.

questions.question: According to Proverbs 21:31, what is prepared against the day of battle?
questions.correctAnswer: The horse
questions.explanation: Proverbs 21:31 says the horse is prepared for battle, but safety comes from the LORD.

questions.question: True or False: Proverbs 21:28 says a false witness will perish, but the man that hears speaks constantly.
questions.correctAnswer: True
questions.explanation: Proverbs 21:28 states that false witnesses perish while those who listen and speak rightly endure.

questions.question: According to Proverbs 21:26, what does the righteous man do that contrasts with the greedy man?
questions.correctAnswer: Gives and spares not
questions.explanation: Proverbs 21:26 contrasts the greedy man who covets all day with the righteous who generously give.

questions.question: What is better according to Proverbs 21:19: to dwell in the wilderness or with whom?
questions.correctAnswer: A contentious and angry woman
questions.explanation: Proverbs 21:19 teaches it is better to live in the wilderness than with a contentious and angry woman.

medium.title: Proverbs Chapter 21 Quiz - Medium Level
medium.description: Ready for more? Apply biblical truths from Proverbs Chapter 21 to real-life situations.

questions.question: A fellow believer struggles with anxiety about the outcome of their plans and asks for counsel. Based on Proverbs 21, what biblical truth would you share about trusting God in decision making?
options: The king's heart is in the hand of the LORD; He directs it wherever He pleases
Plans always succeed when we work hard without considering God
We should rely only on our own understanding and judgment
Success is guaranteed by wealth and treasures
questions.correctAnswer: The king's heart is in the hand of the LORD; He directs it wherever He pleases
questions.explanation: Proverbs 21:1 teaches that God controls the hearts and decisions of leaders and by extension, those who trust Him. Proverbs 21:30 also reminds us that no wisdom or counsel can prevail against the LORD. This encourages believers to trust in God's sovereign direction over their plans.

questions.question: According to Proverbs 21, how should a believer view their own actions and motives when making decisions?
options: Every way of a man is right in his own eyes, but the LORD weighs the heart
Man's judgment is always right and should be trusted above all
Only the opinions of others matter in decision making
Actions are judged solely by their outward appearance
questions.correctAnswer: Every way of a man is right in his own eyes, but the LORD weighs the heart
questions.explanation: Proverbs 21:2 explains that while people often think their ways are right, God examines the true intentions of the heart, reminding believers to seek God's perspective rather than relying solely on their own.

questions.question: What does Proverbs 21 teach about the importance of justice and obedience compared to religious rituals?
options: Doing justice and judgment is more acceptable to the LORD than sacrifice
Sacrifices are the most important way to please God
Religious rituals alone guarantee God's favor
Justice is less important than outward worship
questions.correctAnswer: Doing justice and judgment is more acceptable to the LORD than sacrifice
questions.explanation: Proverbs 21:3 highlights that God values righteous actions like justice and judgment above mere ritual sacrifices. This teaches believers to prioritize obedience and integrity in daily life over empty religious observance.

questions.question: A believer is tempted to act proudly and arrogantly in their success. What warning does Proverbs 21 give about pride?
options: An high look and a proud heart is sin
Pride leads to greater blessings and honor
Pride is a sign of wisdom and understanding
God favors the proud and haughty
questions.correctAnswer: An high look and a proud heart is sin
questions.explanation: Proverbs 21:4 clearly states that pride and arrogance are sinful. This warns believers to cultivate humility as a godly virtue, following the example of Christ.

questions.question: How does Proverbs 21 encourage believers regarding diligence and work ethic?
options: The thoughts of the diligent tend only to plenteousness
Working hard is unnecessary if God is trusted
questions.correctAnswer: The thoughts of the diligent tend only to plenteousness
questions.explanation: Proverbs 21:5 teaches that diligence leads to prosperity, while haste leads to lack. This encourages believers to be diligent and patient in their work as part of faithful stewardship.

questions.question: What does Proverbs 21 say about dishonest gain and lying?
options: Getting treasures by a lying tongue is vanity and leads to death
Lying leads to quick riches and success
Dishonesty is a harmless way to get ahead
questions.correctAnswer: Getting treasures by a lying tongue is vanity and leads to death
questions.explanation: Proverbs 21:6 warns that dishonest gain through lying is ultimately worthless and leads to destruction, teaching believers to pursue honesty and integrity.

questions.question: True or False: According to Proverbs 21, refusing to do justice leads to the destruction of the wicked.
questions.correctAnswer: True
questions.explanation: Proverbs 21:7 teaches that the wicked who refuse to do justice will be destroyed. This shows God's judgment against injustice and encourages believers to pursue righteousness.

questions.question: A believer is struggling with anger towards a contentious family member. What practical wisdom does Proverbs 21 offer about living peacefully in such situations?
options: It is better to dwell in the wilderness than with a contentious and angry woman
Confrontation is always the best way to resolve conflicts
Living with contentious people brings joy and blessing
Ignoring peace leads to spiritual growth
questions.correctAnswer: It is better to dwell in the wilderness than with a contentious and angry woman
questions.explanation: Proverbs 21:19 advises that peace is more valuable than comfort in contentious relationships, encouraging believers to seek peace even if it requires personal sacrifice.

questions.question: How does Proverbs 21 instruct believers regarding generosity and stewardship?
options: The righteous gives and spares not, while the greedy covet all day
Saving all resources is better than giving
Giving should be withheld for personal gain
questions.correctAnswer: The righteous gives and spares not, while the greedy covet all day
questions.explanation: Proverbs 21:26 contrasts the greedy with the righteous who give generously, teaching believers to be open-handed and generous in stewardship.

questions.question: What does Proverbs 21 say about the power of quiet and secret gifts in resolving anger?
options: A gift in secret pacifieth anger, and a reward in the bosom strong wrath
Gifts have no effect on anger
Anger is best resolved by shouting
questions.correctAnswer: A gift in secret pacifieth anger, and a reward in the bosom strong wrath
questions.explanation: Proverbs 21:14 shows that discreet generosity can calm anger effectively, encouraging believers to pursue reconciliation with wisdom and humility.

questions.question: True or False: Proverbs 21 teaches that controlling one's speech is vital to avoid troubles.
questions.correctAnswer: True
questions.explanation: Proverbs 21:23 says that keeping one's mouth and tongue protects the soul from troubles, highlighting the importance of self-control in speech.

questions.question: A believer is tempted to indulge in pleasure and luxury instead of working hard. What warning does Proverbs 21 give about loving pleasure?
options: He that loveth pleasure shall be a poor man
Loving pleasure leads to great wealth
Pleasure is the key to success
questions.correctAnswer: He that loveth pleasure shall be a poor man
questions.explanation: Proverbs 21:17 warns that loving pleasure and indulgence leads to poverty, encouraging believers to prioritize diligence and wise living.

questions.question: How does Proverbs 21 describe the consequences of ignoring the cries of the poor?
options: Whoever stops his ears at the cry of the poor will also cry but not be heard
The cries of the poor are unimportant
Helping the poor leads to loss
questions.correctAnswer: Whoever stops his ears at the cry of the poor will also cry but not be heard
questions.explanation: Proverbs 21:13 teaches that refusing to help the poor leads to one's own unanswered distress, emphasizing compassion and responsibility.

questions.question: Fill in the blank: "He that followeth after righteousness and mercy findeth ____, righteousness, and honour."
questions.correctAnswer: life
questions.explanation: Proverbs 21:21 states that pursuing righteousness and mercy leads to life, righteousness, and honor, highlighting the blessings of godly living.

questions.question: What does Proverbs 21 say about the wisdom of the upright compared to the wicked?
options: The upright direct their way, but the wicked harden their face
The wicked are wiser than the upright
Both wicked and upright follow the same path
Wisdom does not affect one's direction in life
questions.correctAnswer: The upright direct their way, but the wicked harden their face
questions.explanation: Proverbs 21:29 contrasts the behavior of the wicked and upright, showing that the upright are proactive and guided by wisdom, while the wicked are stubborn.

hard.title: Proverbs Chapter 21 Quiz - Hard Level
hard.description: Challenge yourself with deep analysis and cross-biblical connections from Proverbs Chapter 21.

questions.question: What does Proverbs 21:1 illustrate about the sovereignty of God over rulers?
options: The king's heart is directed by the LORD as rivers are directed
Kings rule independently without divine influence
Rulers are controlled by their own desires alone
God only influences common people, not kings
questions.correctAnswer: The king's heart is directed by the LORD as rivers are directed
questions.explanation: Proverbs 21:1 uses the metaphor of rivers to show God's sovereign control over a king's heart, indicating divine providence in governance.

questions.question: According to Proverbs 21:2, what does the LORD ponder that humans often overlook?
questions.correctAnswer: The hearts of men
questions.explanation: Verse 2 contrasts human self-justification with God's deeper examination of the heart, highlighting divine insight beyond human self-perception.

questions.question: Fill in the blank: Proverbs 21:3 states that doing ________ and judgment is more acceptable to the LORD than sacrifice.
questions.correctAnswer: justice
questions.explanation: This verse emphasizes that ethical behavior, particularly justice, is more valued by God than ritual sacrifices, reflecting prophetic critiques found elsewhere in Scripture.

questions.question: What is described as sin in Proverbs 21:4?
options: An high look, a proud heart, and the plowing of the wicked
questions.correctAnswer: An high look, a proud heart, and the plowing of the wicked
questions.explanation: The verse condemns pride and wicked labor, highlighting attitudes and actions that disrupt moral order, which aligns with biblical themes against arrogance.

questions.question: According to Proverbs 21:5, how do the thoughts of the diligent compare to those of the hasty?
options: Diligent thoughts lead to plenteousness; hasty thoughts lead to want
Diligence leads to poverty; haste leads to wealth
Both diligence and haste yield the same results
Hasty thoughts lead to plenteousness; diligent thoughts lead to want
questions.correctAnswer: Diligent thoughts lead to plenteousness; hasty thoughts lead to want
questions.explanation: The verse contrasts steady, careful planning with impulsiveness, illustrating a practical wisdom theme common in Proverbs and echoed in New Testament teachings on stewardship.

questions.question: What does Proverbs 21:6 warn about the acquisition of treasures by lying?
options: It is vanity and leads to death
questions.correctAnswer: It is vanity and leads to death
questions.explanation: The verse highlights the futility and danger of dishonest gain, echoing the biblical principle that ill-gotten wealth ultimately harms the taker.

questions.question: True or False: Proverbs 21:9 teaches that it is preferable to live in a small, uncomfortable space than with a contentious woman in a large house.
questions.correctAnswer: True
questions.explanation: Verse 9 uses a vivid comparison to highlight the value of peace over luxury, a cultural emphasis on harmony within the household.

questions.question: How does Proverbs 21:11 describe the effect of punishing a scorner?
questions.correctAnswer: It makes the simple wise
questions.explanation: The verse presents a didactic principle that consequences for the wicked serve as lessons for the uninformed, illustrating a pedagogical use of discipline.

questions.question: What is the consequence mentioned in Proverbs 21:13 for ignoring the cry of the poor?
options: The one who ignores will cry but not be heard
questions.correctAnswer: The one who ignores will cry but not be heard
questions.explanation: This verse enforces social responsibility and compassion, warning that neglecting the needy leads to personal distress without relief.

questions.question: What does Proverbs 21:20 say about the dwelling of the wise compared to that of a foolish man?
options: There is treasure and oil in the wise man's dwelling; the foolish man spends it all
The foolish man accumulates wealth; the wise man lives poorly
Both have equal wealth and resources
The wise man hoards wealth selfishly
questions.correctAnswer: There is treasure and oil in the wise man's dwelling; the foolish man spends it all
questions.explanation: This contrasts prudent saving with wasteful spending, reflecting the biblical theme of wisdom leading to provision.

questions.question: How does Proverbs 21:21 link righteousness and mercy to life and honor?
options: Following righteousness and mercy leads to life, righteousness, and honor
questions.correctAnswer: Following righteousness and mercy leads to life, righteousness, and honor
questions.explanation: The verse underscores the inseparable nature of ethical behavior and divine blessing, consistent with wisdom literature's moral cause-effect framework.

questions.question: What skill does the wise man demonstrate in Proverbs 21:22?
options: Scaling the city of the mighty and casting down their confidence
questions.correctAnswer: Scaling the city of the mighty and casting down their confidence
questions.explanation: This imagery illustrates wisdom as strategic strength, capable of overcoming formidable obstacles, echoing themes of divine empowerment.

questions.question: According to Proverbs 21:23, what benefit is gained by guarding one’s mouth and tongue?
questions.correctAnswer: Keeping the soul from troubles
questions.explanation: The verse highlights the protective power of self-control in speech, a recurring theme emphasizing wisdom in communication.

questions.question: What does Proverbs 21:25 say about the desire of the slothful?
options: It kills him because he refuses to labor
It motivates him to work hard
questions.correctAnswer: It kills him because he refuses to labor
questions.explanation: The verse warns against laziness and unfulfilled desires, consistent with biblical admonitions against slothfulness.

questions.question: True or False: Proverbs 21:30 declares that there is wisdom, understanding, and counsel against the LORD.
questions.correctAnswer: False
questions.explanation: Verse 30 explicitly states that no wisdom, understanding, or counsel can stand against the LORD, affirming divine supremacy.

theological.title: Proverbs Chapter 21 Quiz - Theological Level
theological.description: Deep biblical theology from Proverbs Chapter 21 that unites all believers. Explore foundational truths about God, creation, and humanity.

questions.question: According to Proverbs 21:1, what does the king's heart symbolize in relation to the LORD's sovereignty?
options: It is like a river of water, directed by the LORD
It is fixed and unchangeable by human hands
It is governed by the counsel of advisors
It is a reflection of the people's will
questions.correctAnswer: It is like a river of water, directed by the LORD
questions.explanation: Proverbs 21:1 states the king's heart is in the hand of the LORD as rivers of water, showing God's sovereign control over human rulers. This aligns with Psalm 33:11 and Daniel 2:21 affirming God's control over kings and nations, Romans 13:1 teaching God's authority over governing authorities, and Isaiah 46:10 declaring God's control over the future.

questions.question: What does Proverbs 21:3 say is more acceptable to the LORD than sacrifice?
questions.correctAnswer: To do justice and judgment
questions.explanation: Verse 3 emphasizes that practicing justice and judgment is more pleasing to God than ritual sacrifice, highlighting the priority of moral righteousness over ritual. This is consistent with Micah 6:8, Isaiah 1:11-17, Hosea 6:6, and Matthew 23:23 where God desires mercy and justice rather than mere sacrifices.

questions.question: How does Proverbs 21:5 contrast the outcomes of the diligent and the hasty?
options: Diligent thoughts lead to abundance; hasty ones lead to want
Both diligent and hasty people attain wealth equally
Hasty thoughts lead to abundance; diligent ones to poverty
Diligent thoughts lead to poverty; hasty ones lead to riches
questions.correctAnswer: Diligent thoughts lead to abundance; hasty ones lead to want
questions.explanation: According to verse 5, diligence is linked to prosperity, while haste results in lack, teaching biblical wisdom about patience and careful planning. This theme is echoed in Ecclesiastes 7:8, Galatians 6:9, 2 Thessalonians 3:10, and Proverbs 13:4.

questions.question: What does Proverbs 21:2 reveal about human self-righteousness and God's judgment?
options: Every man sees his own way as right, but God weighs the heart
Every man is right in God's eyes
God judges only outward actions, not the heart
questions.correctAnswer: Every man sees his own way as right, but God weighs the heart
questions.explanation: Verse 2 teaches that human beings often justify their own ways, but God examines the inner motives, reinforcing the biblical doctrine of God's omniscient judgment. Similar teaching is found in 1 Samuel 16:7, Jeremiah 17:10, Hebrews 4:12, and Romans 8:27.

questions.question: In Proverbs 21:6, what is said about wealth gained through deceitful speech?
options: It is vanity and leads those who seek death
It is a blessing from God
It is a sign of wisdom
questions.correctAnswer: It is vanity and leads those who seek death
questions.explanation: Verse 6 warns that treasure acquired by lying tongues is worthless and dangerous, underscoring the futility of dishonest gain. This aligns with Psalm 62:10, Proverbs 10:2, Jeremiah 17:11, and Revelation 21:8 which warn against deceit and its consequences.

questions.question: What does Proverbs 21:9 teach about living with a contentious woman?
options: It is better to live on a housetop corner than in a wide house with her
Living with her brings great joy
Her presence makes the house prosperous
She brings peace to the household
questions.correctAnswer: It is better to live on a housetop corner than in a wide house with her
questions.explanation: Verse 9 uses a vivid metaphor to illustrate that peace is more valuable than spacious comfort, highlighting the destructiveness of strife. This truth is supported by Ecclesiastes 7:1, 1 Peter 3:7, Proverbs 25:24, and Proverbs 15:1.

questions.question: According to Proverbs 21:11, what is the effect of punishing the scorner on the simple and the wise?
options: The simple become wise; the wise receive knowledge
The simple become foolish; the wise ignore instruction
The simple become proud; the wise become scorners
The simple and wise both reject knowledge
questions.correctAnswer: The simple become wise; the wise receive knowledge
questions.explanation: Verse 11 teaches that discipline of the mocker benefits both the naive and the wise, emphasizing the value of correction. Similar principles appear in Proverbs 9:9, Hebrews 12:11, Psalm 94:12, and Proverbs 12:1.

questions.question: What does Proverbs 21:13 warn about ignoring the cry of the poor?
options: One who ignores will cry out but not be heard
God will bless the one who ignores
The cry of the poor has no effect
questions.correctAnswer: One who ignores will cry out but not be heard
questions.explanation: Verse 13 warns of divine justice against those who neglect the poor, teaching accountability and compassion. This is consistent with Isaiah 1:17, James 2:15-16, Proverbs 14:31, and Matthew 25:40.

questions.question: According to Proverbs 21:15, what emotion is associated with the just doing judgment, and what is the fate of workers of iniquity?
options: Joy for the just; destruction for workers of iniquity
Sorrow for the just; reward for evildoers
Indifference for the just; honor for sinners
Fear for the just; peace for workers of iniquity
questions.correctAnswer: Joy for the just; destruction for workers of iniquity
questions.explanation: Verse 15 contrasts the joy of righteous judgment with the destruction awaiting evildoers, reflecting God's just moral order. This is supported by Psalm 97:11-12, Romans 2:5-8, Isaiah 3:10-11, and Revelation 22:12.

questions.question: What does Proverbs 21:20 say about the wise man’s dwelling compared to the foolish man’s spending?
options: The wise has treasure and oil; the foolish spends it all
The wise spends all; the foolish saves treasure
Both the wise and foolish hoard treasure
Neither the wise nor the foolish has treasure
questions.correctAnswer: The wise has treasure and oil; the foolish spends it all
questions.explanation: Verse 20 highlights the virtue of wise stewardship versus reckless spending, consistent with Luke 14:28, Proverbs 13:11, 1 Timothy 6:6-10, and Ecclesiastes 5:10 teaching contentment and prudence.

questions.question: What does Proverbs 21:21 say one finds by pursuing righteousness and mercy?
questions.correctAnswer: Life, righteousness, and honor
questions.explanation: Verse 21 teaches that the pursuit of righteousness and mercy leads to holistic blessing, reflecting God's covenantal blessings. This is affirmed in Matthew 6:33, Psalm 112:4-5, Proverbs 10:6, and Romans 6:13.

questions.question: According to Proverbs 21:23, what is the benefit of guarding one's mouth and tongue?
questions.correctAnswer: Keeping the soul from troubles
questions.explanation: Verse 23 teaches that self-control in speech protects one’s inner being from harm, consistent with James 1:26, Ephesians 4:29, Psalm 34:13, and Ecclesiastes 10:12.

questions.question: What does Proverbs 21:30 say about wisdom, understanding, and counsel in relation to the LORD?
options: There is no wisdom, understanding, nor counsel against the LORD
Human wisdom can overcome the LORD’s plans
Counsel and understanding can defy God's will
The LORD depends on human counsel
questions.correctAnswer: There is no wisdom, understanding, nor counsel against the LORD
questions.explanation: Verse 30 affirms God's supreme wisdom and sovereignty over all human plans, matching Job 12:13, Isaiah 40:13-14, Romans 11:33, and Jeremiah 10:23 emphasizing God's incomparable wisdom.

questions.question: How does Proverbs 21:31 describe the relationship between preparation and safety in battle?
options: The horse is prepared, but safety is of the LORD
Safety depends only on human strength
The LORD does not influence battle outcomes
questions.correctAnswer: The horse is prepared, but safety is of the LORD
questions.explanation: Verse 31 distinguishes human effort from divine providence, teaching reliance on God for ultimate safety. This theme appears in Psalm 20:7, Isaiah 31:1, Exodus 15:3, and 2 Chronicles 20:15.

questions.question: What does Proverbs 21:26 say about the covetous man in contrast to the righteous?
options: The covetous man greedily desires; the righteous gives generously
The covetous man is generous; the righteous is stingy
The covetous man despises giving; the righteous covets
questions.correctAnswer: The covetous man greedily desires; the righteous gives generously
questions.explanation: Verse 26 contrasts greed with generosity, highlighting the righteous as open-handed, consistent with Luke 6:38, Proverbs 11:24-25, Acts 20:35, and 2 Corinthians 9:7.
